author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Seaham Station and Community Art Launched At Town HallTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Seaham Station and Community Art Launched At Town Hall
A collection of art projects has been launched at Seaham Town Hall, showcasing displays of community art work.
The exhibition has been put together with work by local children and families and is led by community interest company Creative Youth Opportunities CIC from East Durham.
The work includes two murals, which will be installed at Northern Rail’s Seaham station from late September to welcome visitors and brighten up the platform area.
The event celebrates the culmination of a series of three projects funded by East Durham AAP and Durham Constabulary through the community participatory funding stream ‘It’s up 2 u’.
Natalie Loughborough, Customer Service Director for Northern, comments: “It’s great to start further partnership working in the Seaham area, involving local people and stakeholders and helps them to feel part of the station environment. We had the first visual of two murals we have commissioned and got to see the artists working on the third. We also commissioned a fourth piece to be developed by the Mayor of Seaham, Bruce Burn, which we are very excited to display on our station platform from September.”
Source:- Northern Rail
